item.description:
It's time for the next FREE classical music concert for the spring season at the New England Conservatory of Music!

Tonight, Maestro Hugh Wolff conducts the NEC Philharmonia in a rare Monday night symphonic program featuring Haydn's Symphony No. 82, Walton's Viola Concerto, and Shostakovich's Symphony No. 6.  (Listen to excerpts below; the names in the list link to youtube performances of the works.)

For more information about this concert, visit http://necmusic.edu/nec-philharmonia-wolff-1.

NOTE:  Will won't be hosting this event; instead, it will be hosted by Paul K.

Because of the program and the conductor, people should meet up at no later than 7:15pm, so the group can grab a bunch of seats together when the doors open, and then socialize before the concert.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. It's also close to the Mass Ave station on the Orange line.  Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it as you walk down Huntington Ave--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Haydn Symphony No. 82
  • Walton Viola Concerto with soloist Steven Laraia
  • Shostakovich Symphony No. 6
item.how_to_find_us: Paul will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which he will join the group upstairs in the left-middle balcony section.
item.name: NEC Spring Concert Series Bonus: Wolff + Walton, Haydn & Shostakovich
